content.description: Really fun and a must do for the area. Start on the lowest jug and work your way left up the rail to the big jug. Hit the crimp above your head and jump to the last slopy hold.
content.protection: Pads. Use a spotter! The climb goes over a rock and the top out is pretty sketch.
content.location: First problem on your right as you enter the main area.

content.description: Beautiful feature and very fun to follow.Start on the crimpy/slopy botton of the fin and work your way up right on the tiny conglomerate edges. Climb along these holds until you get to the jug directly to the right of the top of the feature. Either top out or jump right back down.
content.location: Walk left along the main wall until you come to the obvious sail/edge/fin type thing. You can't miss it.

content.description: Start on jug of main feature and sloper below, work your way up the main feature and top out.
content.location: Go to the far left of the main boulder area and find the obvious route up the slab face

content.description:
Pretty cool crimpy problem. V6??? Feel free to edit if you know what this is.

To the far left of the rail sds, in the short, overhanging cave that sits on a rock slab. Start matched on the big flake to the right of the arete and move out left to one of the two bumpy crimps. Cross to the other (and sneak in a sweet kneebar) and follow the rest of the crimpers up the arete until you hit the top of the wall. Traverse to the left of the cave (using the lip) and top out.
content.protection: Pads, don't fall while on the lip...
content.location: To the left of the backside of the warm up wall on the arete of the overhanging cave.
